title: Optimizing Fuel Cell Electrode Design: Balancing High Performance and Economic Efficiency

context.prior_knowledge: Comprehension of core concepts and intermediate-level application skills
context.additional_context: Establishing optimization strategies to solve fuel cell design problems required in actual industrial settings

learning_goals: Learners can build a performance prediction model by analyzing the physical/chemical correlations of multilayer electrode design.
Learners can derive design parameters considering cost-performance balance using a machine learning-based optimization algorithm.
Learners can design a decision-making framework to evaluate the techno-economic feasibility of fuel cells by applying the Pareto optimal solution concept.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
